articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A federal judge has dismissed a shareholder lawsuit accusing JPMorgan Chase (JPM.N) Chief Executive Jamie Dimon and his board of directors of ignoring red flags surrounding disgraced former client Jeffrey Epstein.
articles.title: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan board defeat shareholders' Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WeWork (WE.N) warned of a possible bankruptcy in a stunning reversal of fortune for the shared workspace provider that four years ago was one of the world's most prized startups with a valuation of $47 billion.
articles.title: WeWork shares sink after warning of bankruptcy risk

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A conservative legal group on Wednesday urged a U.S. anti-discrimination agency to investigate Kellogg Co (K.N) over workplace diversity policies that it says are unlawful, and accused the cereal maker of sexualizing its products.
articles.title: Kellogg's 'woke' workplace diversity programs are illegal, group claims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Reserve Bank of India's key lending rate was held steady for a third straight policy meeting on Thursday, as widely expected, as inflation concerns resurfaced following higher-than-usual seasonal spikes in food prices in recent weeks.
articles.title: India's central bank holds key rate steady as expected

articles.author: Josh Ye
articles.description: China will require all mobile app providers in the country to file business details with the government, its information ministry said, marking Beijing's latest effort to keep the industry on a tight leash.
articles.title: China to require all apps to share business details in new oversight push

articles.author: Neil Morales, Enrico Cruz
articles.description: The Philippine economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly 12 years in the second quarter as high inflation and interest rates hurt consumer demand, reducing pressure on the central bank to tighten monetary policy further.
articles.title: Philippines Q2 GDP growth slowest in nearly 12 years as rate hikes drag

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Chevron (CVX.N) and Woodside Energy Group (WDS.AX) said on Thursday they are holding talks with unions to avert threatened strikes at gas facilities that together supply about 10% of the global liquefied natural gas (LNG) market.
articles.title: Chevron, Woodside in talks to avert strikes at Australian LNG operations

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: A suspect in the killing of Ecuador presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio has died from injuries sustained during a shootout, the attorney general's office said on Wednesday on social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter.
articles.title: Suspect in killing of Ecuador candidate Villavicencio dead, prosecutor's office says

articles.author: Karen Freifeld, Andrea Shalal, David Shepardson
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order that will narrowly prohibit certain U.S. investments in sensitive technology in China and require government notification of funding in other tech sectors.
articles.title: Biden signs order to ban certain tech investments in China

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets
articles.description: Two people were killed and seven injured in an apparent missile attack by Russia on the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia on Wednesday, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Two dead after Russian attack on Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia -minister
